tasks.task: Perform mechanical weed control methods on crops.
subtasks: Till the soil to remove weeds and injure their roots and stems.
Harrow the soil to lay weeds open to sun and destroy them.
Hoe rows between crops to destroy perennial weeds and control annuals.
Use a khurpi or sickle to manually pull out weeds, especially annuals and bi-annuals.
Dig deep to remove perennial weeds' underground parts.
Use a sickle to cut weeds, preventing seed production.
Move cut weeds to another location to prevent regrowth.
Burn weed tops in sugar cane fields after harvest.
Flood fields with water for extended periods to kill water-sensitive weeds.

tasks.task: Operate machinery for mechanical weed control.
subtasks: Drive a tractor and attach a cultivator to hoe between crop rows.
Operate a harrow attachment to bury and destroy weeds.
Use a roadside weed mover to sickle tall weeds without uprooting.
Manage fire safety while burning weeds in designated areas.

tasks.task: Maintain equipment and tools.
subtasks: Sharpen and adjust tools like hoes, sickles, and cultivators for efficient cutting.
Lubricate and maintain machinery to prevent breakdown during field operations.
Clean tools and equipment after use to prevent soil spread diseases.
